lesson: Unit 4 - Precision in Speech and Argumentation

questions.question: Why is precision important in spoken language?
answers: To make ideas clear and authoritative.
questions.correct: To make ideas clear and authoritative.

questions.question: What is a benefit of using examples in an argument?
answers: They clarify abstract ideas and support claims.
They skip making connections for the listener.
questions.correct: They clarify abstract ideas and support claims.

questions.question: Why use concise language in speeches?
answers: To maintain listener focus and understanding.
To skip making a point clearly.
To add redundancy to an argument.
questions.correct: To maintain listener focus and understanding.

questions.question: Why is a strong opening statement vital?
answers: To capture attention and set the tone.
To skip making the point clearly.
questions.correct: To capture attention and set the tone.

questions.question: Why use evidence in an argument?
answers: To build credibility and justify claims.
To skip making a strong point clearly.
questions.correct: To build credibility and justify claims.

questions.question: Why consider audience expectations in speech?
answers: To make language and examples relevant and impactful.
questions.correct: To make language and examples relevant and impactful.

questions.question: Why use varied intonation?
answers: To maintain listener interest and highlight key ideas.
questions.correct: To maintain listener interest and highlight key ideas.

questions.question: Why anticipate counter-arguments?
answers: To strengthen one’s own position and build trust.
questions.correct: To strengthen one’s own position and build trust.

questions.question: Why focus on word choice in speech?
answers: To ensure precision and clarity in ideas.
questions.correct: To ensure precision and clarity in ideas.

questions.question: Why use pauses strategically?
answers: To emphasize points and aid understanding.
questions.correct: To emphasize points and aid understanding.

questions.question: Why maintain a confident tone?
answers: To build trust and authority with listeners.
questions.correct: To build trust and authority with listeners.

questions.question: Why organize ideas clearly?
answers: To help listeners follow and comprehend.
questions.correct: To help listeners follow and comprehend.

questions.question: Why adjust language for formality?
answers: To suit context and audience expectations.
questions.correct: To suit context and audience expectations.

questions.question: Why ask questions during a speech?
answers: To engage listeners and invite reflection.
questions.correct: To engage listeners and invite reflection.
